title: Protocol for Comprehensive Synthetic Lethality Screens
procedures:
Step-by-Step Method Details
Step-by-Step Method Details
Titer Drug Concentration
Timing: 30 min (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2])
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/63-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Drug Preparation
(A) Cartoon of serial dilution to prepare 3-fold drug dilution.
This step allows you to determine what drug concentration (GDC0941) to use in your screen.
Prepare 3-fold serial dilution (9μM, 3μM, 1μM, 333nM, 111nM, 37nM, 12nM, DMSO) at 2X
Thaw a small aliquot of GDC0941 while you prepare tubes
Set up 2 tubes with 750μl of Jurkat media and 6 tubes with 500μl of Jurkat media
Add 1.35μl of 10mM GDC0941 to one tube containing 750μl and mix. This will be 9 μM
Transfer 250 μl from 9 μM tube to a tube containing 500 μl and mix. This will be 3 μM.
Transfer 250 μl from 3 μM tube to a tube containing 500 μl and mix. This will be 1 μM.
Repeat previous dilution until 12nM tube.
For DMSO control, add 1.35μl DMSO to the last tube containing 750μl
Transfer 200μl of each inhibitor concentration into two adjacent wells (for duplicates) of a 48 well plate
Analyzing Cell Proliferation with Flow Cytometry
Timing: 2h
This step describes how to obtain the cell counts with flow cytometry with live/dead/apoptotic discrimination
Prepare Jurkat cell line.
Count cells according to your preferred method
Resuspend 2x10 6cells at 400x103 cells/ml with Jurkat media
Add 200μl of cells to 48 well plate containing inhibitors
Let the cells proliferate in the incubator for 3 days at 37°C
Set up reagents for 20 samples. Final volume will be 200μl.
10X CaCl2 in PBS (20mM). Table 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl1]
table:files/protocols_protocol_63_1.csv
10X Acridine Orange (AO, 200nM) and Propidium Iodide (PI, 2μM). Add 20μl of 10μM AO and 20μl of 100μM PI stocks to 1ml PBS. Table 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl1]

10X Annexin V–APC in FACS Buffer. 1μl of Annexin V + 19μl of FACS Buffer for each sample.
123count eBeads Counting Beads. Remember manufacturer exact counts (∼106beads/ml)
Prepare a pre-mix transferring 200μl of each of the reagents (10X CaCl2 in PBS (20mM), 10X AO/PI (200nM/2μM), 10X Annexin-V in FACS Buffer (1:19), eBioscience 123 count Beads) into 1ml tube.
Add 80μl of the previous pre-mix into 16 1.2ml Micro titer tubes
Add 120μl of each well of cell proliferation experiment seeded 3 days ago into previous 1.2ml Micro titer tubes containing the pre-mix. Keep tubes on ice.
Run the samples in a Flow cytometer machine (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]A) with the appropriate Lasers and filters. E.g. AO in FITC, PI in mCherry, Annexin V in APC, Beads in Pacific Blue and AmCyan
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/63-Fig3.jpg
Figure 3. Flow Cytometry Analysis
(A) Picture of a flow machine suitable for the analysis.
(B) Representative flow cytometry panel of Live/Dead proliferation experiment. Beads are gated on Pacific Blue vs AMcyan. Nucleated cells are gated on Acridine Orange (FITC+). Apoptotic cells are gated on Annexin V+ Propidium Iodide (PI)-. Dead cells are gated Propidium Iodide (PI)+.
(C) Representative phospho-flow analysis of baseline pAKT (red) and pS6 (green) levels on Jurkat.
Flow Cytometry Analysis
Timing: variable
This step describes a proposal of gating strategy in order to reduce variability. (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]B)
No gating in FCS/SSC
All events in Pacific Blue and AmCyan. Gate double positive beads
All events in FITC and mCherry. Gate on AO+ (nucleated cells)
AO+ events in mCherry and APC. Make quad gate: live cells (PI-Annexin V-), apoptotic cells (PI- Annexin V+) dead cells (PI+ Annexin V+)
Get counts of each parameter

Cell concentration (cells/ml) = bead concentration x (cell count x bead volume) / (bead count x cell volume). For example, Cell concentration (cells/ml) = ∼106 beads/ml x (cell count x 20μl) / (beads count x 120μl)
Signaling Experiment
Timing: 2 days
This step describes how to analyze the effect of 1h of GDC0941 in PI3K signaling by measuring levels of pAKT and pS6
Prepare Drug concentration as above.
Resuspend 8x106 Jurkat cells with 4ml of Jurkat media (2x106 cells/ml)
Add 400μl of each GDC0941 concentration (9μM, 3μM, 1μM, 333nM, 111nM, 37nM, 12nM, DMSO) in a different well of a 12 well plate
Add 400μl of Jurkat cells into each well containing GDC0941. Mix well and incubate for 1h at 37°C.
Add 200μl of 10% PFA and incubate at RT for 5 min. Transfer cells to 1.5ml tube
Centrifuge 5 min at 500G, remove supernatant, resuspend cells by flicking.
Add 300μl of 90% ice-cold methanol and incubate at -20°C at least 12-16h.
Pause Point: Samples here can be stored at -20 for up to 2 months.
Add 1ml of FACS buffer and incubate 5 min to rehydrate
Prepare primary antibody
pAKT S473: 495μl of FACS buffer + 5μl of pAKT antibody
pS6 S235/236: 499μl of FACS buffer + 1μl of pS6 antibody
Control: 500μl of FACS buffer
Centrifuge cells for 2 min at 2500G, remove supernatant, resuspend cells by flicking
Add 150μl of FACS buffer
Split each condition (50μl) in 3 wells of a U-shaped 96 well plate
Add 150μl of FACS buffer
Centrifuge for 2 min at 2500G, remove supernatant, resuspend cells by flicking
Add 50μl of each antibody mix (pAKT, pS6 and control) to each condition.
Incubate 30 min at RT
Prepare 2ary antibody
Donkey anti-rabbit-PE: 1386μl of FACS buffer + 14ul of antibody

Wash cells twice with 200μl of FACS buffer
Add 50μl of 2ary antibody to each well
Incubate 15 min in the darkness at RT
Wash twice with 200μl of FACS buffer at 2500G for 2 min
Resuspend the cells with 150μl of FACS buffer and acquire on a flow cytometer.
Analyze your data e.g. in histograms that depict the levels of pAkt or pS6 (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]C).
Lentiviral Transduction
Timing: 10–12 days
This step describes the infection of Jurkat cell line containing the shRNA library with at least 2000X coverage. The shRNA-encoding vector has mCherry reporter gene and Puromycin selection gene.
Jurkat cell line is expanded in regular flasks until desired cell number is achieved
Day -9: shRNA library contains ∼1,800 genes with 55,000 shRNAs. To use a 2000X coverage 1.1x108  lentiviral infectious units are seeded with 1.6x108 Jurkat cells to achieve a MOI of 0.7 in 80ml total in a roller bottle (Figure 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig4]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/63-Fig4.jpg
Figure 4. Jurkats Containing the shRNA Library Are Resistant to Puromycin after Treatment
(A) Picture of a roller bottle in the roller bottle specific incubator.
(B) Representative flow cytometry histogram of Puromycin/mCherry selection from untransduced cells, day -7, day -3 and day 0.
Leave cells with lentivirus 12-16h in the incubator.
Day -8: Next morning add 90ml of fresh Jurkat media.
Day -7: Analyze mCherry expression by flow cytometry and start treatment with 2μg/ml of Puromycin (previously tittered: protocol not described). Split cells when necessary adding 2μg/ml of Puromycin keeping cell density between 105 and 10 6 cells/ml to ensure they are in exponential growth.
Critical: Do not use less than 1.1x108 cells. Coverage might be compromised
Day -3: Analyze mCherry expression by flow cytometry.
Day 0: Analyze mCherry expression by flow cytometry. Cells should be >90% positive. (Figure 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig4]B).

Note: If less than 90% of the cells are mCherry positive, continue the puromycin selection.
Cryopreserve at least 1.1x108 cells at T0.
Cell Growth and Selection Screen
Timing: 3–4 weeks
Expand Jurkat cell line with GDC0941 or DMSO for ∼3 weeks to allow for shRNA-induced cell death (synthetic lethality). Note that enrichment for shRNA species can also be picked up.
Day 0: Add 1.1x108 cells into 2 different roller bottles and fill up to 250ml of fresh Jurkat media with 1μg/ml of Puromycin. One bottle will have GDC0941 at 1.4μM, the concentration at which cell growth is reduced by 20% and phospho-signaling is reduced according to drug titration. 35μl of GDC0941 at 10mM will be added to the bottle. Same amount of DMSO will be added to the control bottle
Day 1: Split the 250ml of each bottle of GDC0941 and DMSO into 2 roller bottles (125 each bottle), to ensure there is not cell saturation. Add 125ml of new fresh media to each bottle with 17.5μl of GDC0941 at 10mM or DMSO and 1μg/ml of Puromycin.
Note: Puromycin can be reduced at 0.5-1μg/ml to maintain the selection
Day 3: Count and check cell viability. Split cells down to 5.5x107 cells each bottle, add fresh Jurkat media up to 250ml with 1μg/ml of Puromycin and 1.4μM of GDC0941 or DMSO.
Repeat previous step every two or three days according to your cell growth. Keeping them under 2x106cells/ml
On day 22, snap freeze. Count cells, centrifuge 1.2x108 cells 5min at 1500rpm, discard supernatant, transfer them into a 5ml cryovial, centrifuge and discard supernatant again. Resuspend cells in remaining liquid and snap freeze at liquid N2 for 1 min before you keep it at -80 for long term storage.

Note: we chose a 22-day screening period. This is somewhat arbitrary and could be shortened. The reason to allow for a longer selection period here was two-fold. First, we use a very modest concentration of PI3K inhibitor as backdrop. Second, we wanted to be sure to catch synthetic lethality that was not instantly but could take several days.
Pause Point: You can cryopreserve cells during the splitting days if you would like to preserve material from time points while the screen is ongoing.
gDNA Extraction
Timing: 2–3 h
This step describes the extraction of gDNA from frozen pellet.
Use the QIAamp DNA Blood Maxi Kit. Protocol is slightly modified from the manufacturer. Before to start, warm water bath to 70°C, thaw an aliquot of Protease and set up the vacuum manifold connectors (Figure 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig5]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/63-Fig5.jpg
Figure 5. Vacuum Manifold for DNA Extraction
(A) Vacuum manifold connected to the vacuum system for DNA extraction.
Thaw cell pellet at RT.
Resuspend cells completely when thawed.
Add 8.5ml of PBS and mix while transferring solution to a 50ml tube.
Add 500μl of Protease and mix.
Add 12 ml of buffer AL.
Invert 15 times to mix, then shake vigorously for 1 min. DO NOT VORTEX.
Close tube tightly and incubate 15min at 70°C, shake every 5 min.
Add 10ml of 100% EtOH.
Invert 15 times to mix, then shake vigorously for 1 min. DO NOT VORTEX.
Note: Each sample is divided in 2 columns.
Add half of volume (∼15ml) to each column. Taking care not moisten the rim.
Open the vacuum ad let the lysate pass through the column.
Wash with 15ml of AW1 – 30-60min.
Wash with 15ml of AW2 – 15-30 min.
Dry each membrane individually opening the valve for 10s.
Wipe rim with dry clean tissue.

Dry all columns for 30 min with vacuum.
Transfer columns into 50ml tubes.
Add 600μl of AE buffer, incubate for 5 min, centrifuge 5min at 3500g.
Add 600μl of AE buffer, incubate for 5 min, centrifuge 5min at 3500g.
Add 400μl of AE buffer, incubate for 5 min, centrifuge 10min at 3500g.
Final volume ∼1100-1200μl.
Transfer elution into a 1.5ml tube.
Determine DNA concentration.
gDNA Digestion
Timing: 16–18 h
This step describes the digest of whole gDNA to excise the band of interest.
In a 2ml tube add the following:
1100μl of gDNA.
123μl of CutSmart Buffer.
8μl of PstI-HF restriction enzyme.
Incubate 12-16h at 37°C in a rotation.
Estimate digestion by running 2μl of digested DNA and 1μl of undigested in a 1.5% agarose gel.
You are expecting a smear on the digested gDNA (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/63-Fig6.jpg
Figure 6. Illustrated Steps for gDNA Extraction
(A) Representative agarose gel with undigested DNA (left) and PstI-HF digestion 12-16h.
(B) An excised piece of agarose inside 10ml syringe (left) and same piece slurred down (right).
(C) Representative picture of an orange gel extraction buffer (left) and yellow gel extraction buffer (right).
(D) 15ml tube with the end cut (left) and same tube inside columns (right).
(E) 15ml tube with the cut end inside the columns sealed with parafilm and ensembled in the vacuum manifold (left) same but with yellow extraction buffer (right).
DNA Gel Extraction
Timing: 2 days
This step describes how to excise the gel portion to extract the size of interest.
Prepare a 0.6% agarose gel in a large caster. Make sure the gel has 3 lanes. 1 big lane in the middle which will hold 1400μl and 1 to each side for the ladder.
Once the gel is solidified, transfer it to the cold room (4°C).

Carefully pull out the combs and check for integrity.
Add 130μl of 10X DNA loading dye to digested DNA.
Load along with 1kb ladder and run the gel at 130V in the cold room (4°C) - 1-2h.
Cut band of interest out of the gel. In this protocol is 2.2kb (Between 1.5 and 4kb markers).
Weight the fragment of gel. From this moment we will assume the gel’s weight is 10g.
Place the fragment of the gel in a 10ml syringe.
Push the gel slurry down using the syringe into a 50ml tube (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]B).
Place it at -20°C for at least 12-16h.
Pause Point: Sample can be stored at -20°C for longer if desired.
Thaw it at RT – 30-60 min.
Use QIAquick Gel extraction kit using vacuum Manifold. Little modifications of the protocol are made.
Add 30 ml of QC buffer to the 50ml tube.
Incubate the tube at 50°C for 5-10 min or until the gel is melted. Mix to accelerate the process.
After the gel has dissolved completely, check that the color of the mixture is yellow. If the mixture is orange or violet add 10 μl of 3M sodium acetate pH 5 until the solution turns yellow (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]C).
Use 2 columns for each sample. Take a new clean 15ml tube cut the bottom part of them with a clean blade. Making a hole. Place the tube inside the column (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]D).
Seal the 15ml tube and the column with parafilm in order to add the solution in fewer steps (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]E).
Add half of the volume (∼20ml) to each 15ml tube (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]E).
Let the solution go through the column using the vacuum.
Remove the 15ml tubes.
Wash twice with 500μl of QG buffer.
Wash 3 times with 800μl of PE buffer.

Vacuum for 5 min to dry the membrane.
Transfer the column to a 2ml collection tube.
Centrifuge at Max speed for 5 min and discard the collection tube.
Place the column to a new 1.5ml low DNA bind tube.
Elute each column twice with 55μl of EB and combine to one tube.
Final volume ∼200μl.
Determine DNA concentration.
Run 2μl of the elution in a 1.5% agarose gel to confirm DNA extraction. A smear is a good sign.
DNA Amplification and Barcoding
Timing: variable
This step describes the amplification of shRNA from the proviral DNA and barcoded for sequencing.
DNA concentration is adjusted to 40ng/μl
PCR optimization for temperature and cycles
Prepare small amount of primers at 10μM for optimization. TrueSeqIndex forward and a common revers primer are used for barcode
PCR are performed using NEB HiFi Phusion polymerase
PCR pre-mix for 5 well to test temperature. Prepare on ice and add in the following order. Table 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl2]
table:files/protocols_protocol_63_2.csv
Split 20μl to 4 different 0.2ml PCR tubes. Pre-heat the thermocycler at 98°C prior to add the tubes. Skip this step once the tubes are in the thermocycler (Figure 7[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig7]A)
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/63-Fig7.jpg
Figure 7. Indexing PCR
(A) Thermocycler with a gradient of temperatures used to choose the appropriate annealing temperature and number of cycles for indexing.
(B) Photo of the PCR cycle used to assess the right temperature of annealing (left & right).
Cycling protocol (Figure 7[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig7]B)
Stage 1 - 98°C - Forever
Stage 2 - 98°C – 3 min
Stage 3; step 1 - 98°C – 15s
Stage 3; step 2 - Four gradients of temperatures according to your primers – 30s
Stage 3; step 3 - 72°C – 30 s
Repeat stage 3, 29 times
Stage 4; step 1 - 72°C – 5min

Stage 4; step 2 - 4°C – Forever
Run samples at 1% agarose and choose the temperature that show the neat 270bp band
PCR pre-mix for 10 well to test cycles. Prepare on ice and add in the following order. Table 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl4]
table:files/protocols_protocol_63_3.csv
Split 20μl to 9 different 0.2ml PCR tubes. Pre-heat the thermocycler at 98°C prior to add the tubes. Skip this step once the tubes are in the thermocycler
Cycling protocol
Stage 1 - 98°C – Forever
Stage 2 - 98°C – 3 min
Stage 3; step 1 - 98°C – 15s
Stage 3; step 2 - Previously step chosen temperature – 30s
Stage 3; step 3 - 72°C – 30 s
Repeat stage 3, 30 times
Critical: Remove from the thermocycles one tube at cycles 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20, 22, 24, 28 and put them on ice until the cycle reach 30. Then add all the tubes again to the thermocycles to finish the last elongation step
Stage 4; step 1 - 72°C – 5min
Stage 4; step 2 - 4°C – Forever
Run samples at 1% agarose and choose the cycle that first shows a single 270bp band before higher and lower band form.
Now you are ready to scale up reaction. Multiply previous volumes for 75x. Table 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl3]
table:files/protocols_protocol_63_4.csv
Divide into twelve 0.2ml tubes (120μl each). Pre-heat the thermocycler at 98°C prior to add the tubes. Skip this step once the tubes are in the thermocycler
ycling protocol
Stage 1 - 98°C - Forever
Stage 2 - 98°C – 3 min
Stage 3; step 1 - 98°C – 15s
Stage 3; step 2 - Temperature – 30s
Stage 3; step 3 - 72°C – 30 s
Repeat stage 3, “n” times
Stage 4; step 1 - 72°C – 5min

Stage 4; step 2 - 4°C – Forever
Combine all PCR products from previous 12 tubes and run 15μl in a 1% agarose gel
Confirm there is a neat 270bp band
PCR Product Concentration
Timing: 30 min
This step reduces the volume of the PCR reaction. QIAquick PCR purification kit is used.
Mix 1.5ml of PCR reaction + 7.5ml of Buffer PB
If the color of the mixture is orange or violet add 10μl of 3M sodium acetate pH 5 and mix. Repeat until color of the mix will turn yellow (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]C)
Run each sample into 2 columns. Place a column into a 2ml collection tube
Add 750μl of solution into each column
Centrifuge for 30-60s at Max speed and discard flow-through
Add 750μl of solution again and centrifuge until all solution run through the columns
Wash twice with 1ml of PE buffer.
Centrifuge for 30-60s at Max speed.
Place the column into a new 2ml collection tube and centrifuge for 1 min to remove residual wash buffer.
Place each column in a clean low-DNA binding tube.
Add 55μl EB buffer to each column.
Incubate for 1 min at RT and centrifuge for 1 min at max speed.
Combine elution from both columns. Final volume will be 110μl.
PCR Purification from Agarose Gel
Timing: 4–6h
This step describes the isolation of PCR product from agarose gel.
Note: Different techniques can be used to isolate index DNA band from a gel. Mues et al. (Mues et al., 2019[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1]) described a purification using polyacrylamide gel and isolation from a gel with electro-elution. We have since had better success with agarose gel purification, which we describe here.
Prepare a 0.6% agarose gel.
Once the gel is solidified, transfer it to the cold room (4°C)

Add 11μl of 10X loading dye to the 110μl eluted previously
Load along with a ladder (i.e. GeneRuler 1kb Plus DNA Ladder) and run the gel at 130V in the cold room (4°C)
Cut band of interest out of the gel. In this protocol it is 270 bp fragment and safe for extraction.
Weigh the fragment of gel. From this moment we will assume the gel weight is 1g.
Use QIAquick Gel extraction kit using microcentrifuge protocol. Slight modifications are made.
Add 3 ml of QC buffer to the 15ml tube.
Incubate the tube at 50°C for 5-10 min or until the gel is melted. Mix to accelerate the process.
After the gel has dissolved completely, check that the color of the mixture is yellow. If mixture is orange or violet add 10 μl of 3M sodium acetate pH 5 until the solution turns yellow (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]C).
Add 1ml of 2-propanol to increase the yield. Only works for DNA fragments <400bp and >4kb.
Place the column into 2ml collection tube.
Add 800μl of the solution and centrifuge for 1 min at max speed.
Discard flow-through and place the column back to the collection tube.
Add 800μl more of the solution and centrifuge for 1 min. Repeat as much as you need.
Wash once with 500μl of QG buffer.
Wash twice with 800μl of PE buffer.
Centrifuge at max speed for 2 min and discard the collection tube.
Place the column to a new 1.5ml low DNA bind tube.
Elute each column twice with 50μl of EB and combine.
Determine DNA concentration.
